bapsflib.lapdhdf¶

The lapdhdf module contains the necessary tools to open, identify, check, map out, and read out data written into HDF5 files by the LaPD DAQ system.

Subpackages¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_controls
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_msi

Modules¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.files
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata

bapsflib.lapdhdf.files¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File(name, mode='r', driver=None, libver=None, userblock_size=None, swmr=False, **kwargs)¶

Bases: h5py._hl.files.File

Open a HDF5 File.

see h5py documentation for h5py.File details: http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/

Parameters:
  • name (str) – Name of file (str or unicode)
  • mode (str) – Mode in which to open the file. (default ‘r’ read-only)
  • driver – File driver to use
  • libver – Compatibility bounds
  • userblock_size – Size (in bytes) of the user block. If nonzero, must be a power of 2 and at least 512.
  • swmr – Single Write, Multiple Read
  • kwargs – Driver specific keywords
exp_descr¶
Returns:Experimental description stored in the HDF5 file.
Return type:str
file_map¶
Returns:HDF5 file mappings
Return type:bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers.hdfMap

listHDF_file_types¶
Returns:list of strings indicating if an HDF5 item is a Group or Dataset. This has a one-to-one correspondence to listHDF_files.
Return type:list(str)
listHDF_files¶
Returns:list of strings representing the absolute paths (base + filename) for each Group and Dataset in the HDF5 file.
Return type:list(str)
list_controls¶
Returns:list of strings naming the controls found in the HDF5 file
Return type:list(str)

Return type:list(str)
list_msi¶
Returns:list of strings naming the MSI diagnostics found in the HDF5 file
Return type:list(str)
read_controls(controls, index=None, shotnum=None, intersection_set=True, silent=False, **kwargs)¶

Provides access to hdfReadControl to extract data from specified control device dataset(s) in the HDF5 file. See hdfReadControl for more detail.

Parameters:
  • controls ([str, (str, val), ]) – a list of strings and/or 2-element tuples indicating control device data to be extracted. (see hdfReadControl for details)
  • index (int, list(int), slice()) – row index of the 1st specified control device dataset or row index of the array of intersecting shot numbers (see hdfReadControl for details)
  • shotnum (int, list(int), slice()) – HDF5 global shot number
  • intersection_set (bool) – True (default) forces the returned array to only contain shot numbers that are in the intersection of shotnum and all the control device datasets. (see hdfReadControl for details)
  • silent (bool) – False (default). Set True to suppress command line printout of soft-warnings
Returns:

extracted data from control device(s)
Return type:

hdfReadControl
read_data(board, channel, index=None, shotnum=None, digitizer=None, adc=None, config_name=None, keep_bits=False, add_controls=None, intersection_set=True, silent=False, robust_define=False, **kwargs)¶

Provides access to hdfReadData to extract data from a specified digitizer dataset in the HDF5 file and, if requested, mate control device data to the extracted digitizer data. See hdfReadData for more detail.

Parameters:
  • board (int) – digitizer board number
  • channel (int) – digitizer channel number
  • index (int, list(int), slice()) – dataset row index
  • shotnum (int, list(int), slice()) – HDF5 global shot number
  • digitizer (str) – name of digitizer
  • adc (str) – name of the digitizer’s analog-digital converter
  • config_name (str) – name of digitizer configuration
  • keep_bits (bool) – True for output in bits, False (default) for output in voltage
  • add_controls ([str, (str, val), ]) – a list of strings and/or 2-element tuples indicating control device data to be mated to the digitizer data. (see hdfReadData for details)
  • intersection_set (bool) – True (default) forces the returned array to only contain shot numbers that are in the intersection of shotnum, the digitizer dataset, and all the control device datasets. (see hdfReadData for details)
  • silent (bool) – False (default). Set True to suppress command line printout of soft-warnings
  • robust_define (bool) – performs a double check to make sure the dataset shot numbers match the expedted shot numbers… dheader[index, shotnumkey] == shotnum
Returns:

extracted data from digitizer (and control devices)
Return type:

hdfReadData

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks¶

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks.control_print_out(silent)¶
class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks.hdfCheck(hdf_obj, silent=False, save_report=False)¶

Bases: object

Initiates the HDF5 mapping constructor (hdfMap) and prints a file report to screen (or file).

Parameters:
  • hdf_obj (h5py.File) – HDF5 file object
  • silent (bool) – False (default). Set True to suppress command line printout of file report.
  • save_report (bool or str) – False (default). Set True to save file report to a txt file of the same name as the HDF5 file or set to string to specify file name.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors¶

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error¶

Bases: Exception

Base class for exceptions in the lapdhdf module.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NoMSIError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if no MSI group is detected in the opened HDF5 file.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotHDFFileError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if desired object is not an instance of h5py.File.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotKnownLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if the HDF5 file was generated by the DAQ system but is not a known software version.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if HDF5 file was not generated by the LaPD DAQ system.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers.hdfMap(hdf_obj)¶

Bases: object

Constructs a complete file mapping of hdf_obj that is utilized by bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File to manipulate and read data out of the HDF5 file.

The following classes are leveraged to construct the mappings:

  • hdfMap_controls.
  • hdfMap_digitizers.
  • hdfMap_msi.
Parameters:hdf_obj (h5py.File) – the HDF5 file object
controls¶
Returns:A dictionary containing all control device mapping objects.
Return type:dict

For example, to retrieve mappings of the control device '6K Compumotor' one would call:

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
mmap = fmap.controls['6K Compumotor']
data_gname = 'Raw data + config'¶

Name of the DATA HDF5 group

digitizers¶
Returns:A dictionary containing all digitizer mapping objects.
Return type:dict

For example, to retrieve mappings of digitizer 'SIS 3301' one would call:

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
dmap = fmap.digitizers['SIS 3301']
has_controls¶
Returns:True if known control devices are discovered in the data group (i.e. controls is not empty)
Return type:bool
has_data_group¶
Returns:True if data group (data_gname) group is detected
Return type:bool
has_data_run_sequence¶
Returns:True if the ‘Data run sequence/’ group is found in the data group
Return type:bool
has_digitizers¶
Returns:True if any known digitizers are discovered in the data group (i.e digitizers is not empty)
Return type:bool
has_msi_group¶
Returns:True if MSI group (msi_gname) is detected
Return type:bool
has_unknown_data_subgoups¶
Returns:True if there are any subgroups in the data group that are not known by the mapping constructors.
hdf_version¶
Returns:the LaPD DAQ Software version number used to generated the HDF5 file (‘’ if NOT LaPD generated)
Return type:str
is_lapd_hdf¶
Returns:True if the HDF5 file was generated by the LaPD
Return type:bool
main_digitizer¶
Returns:the mapping object for the digitizer that is assumed to be the ‘main digitizer’ in digitizers

The main digitizer is determine by scanning through the local tuple possible_candidates that contains a hierarchical list of digitizers. The first digitizer found is assumed to be the ‘main digitizer’.:

possible_candidates = ('SIS 3301', 'SIS crate')
msi¶
Returns:A dictionary containing all MSI diagnostic mappings objects.
Return type:dict

For example, to retrieve mappings of LaPD’s Magnetic field one would call:

fmap = hdfMap(file_obj)
bmap = fmap.msi['Magnetic field']
msi_gname = 'MSI'¶

Name of the MSI HDF5 group.

unknowns¶
Returns:A list containing all the subgroup names for the subgroups in the data group (data_gname that are unknown to the mapping constructor.
Return type:list

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol¶

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol.condition_controls(hdf_file, controls, silent=False)¶
bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol.gather_shotnums(hdf_file, controls, method='union', assume_controls_conditioned=False)¶
class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol.hdfReadControl(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: numpy.recarray

Extracts control device data from the HDF5 file.

Parameters:
  • hdf_file (bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File) – object instance of the HDF5 file
  • controls ([str, (str, val), ]) – a list indicating the desired control devices (see bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol.condition_controls() for details)
  • index (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, step)) – row index (see ‘index behavior below’)
  • shotnum (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, step)) – HDF5 file shot number(s) indicating data entries to be extracted (shotnum will take precedence over index)
  • intersection_set (bool) –
  • silent (bool) –
Behavior of index
  • indexing starts at 0
  • is overridden by shotnum
  • if intersection_set=True
    • If len(controls) == 1, then index will be the dataset row index.
    • If len(controls) > 1, then index will correspond to the index of the list of intersecting shot numbers of all specified control devices.
  • if intersection_set=False
    • index corresponds to the row index of the dataset for the first control device listed in controls.

Behavior of shotnum

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶
static __new__(hdf_file, controls, index=None, shotnum=None, intersection_set=True, silent=False, **kwargs)¶
Parameters:
  • hdf_file (bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File) – object instance of the HDF5 file
  • controls ([str, (str, val), ]) – a list indicating the desired control devices (see bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreadcontrol.condition_controls() for details)
  • index (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, step)) – row index (see ‘index behavior below’)
  • shotnum (None, int, list(int), or slice(start, stop, step)) – HDF5 file shot number(s) indicating data entries to be extracted (shotnum will take precedence over index)
  • intersection_set (bool) –
  • silent (bool) –
Behavior of index
  • indexing starts at 0
  • is overridden by shotnum
  • if intersection_set=True
    • If len(controls) == 1, then index will be the dataset row index.
    • If len(controls) > 1, then index will correspond to the index of the list of intersecting shot numbers of all specified control devices.
  • if intersection_set=False
    • index corresponds to the row index of the dataset for the first control device listed in controls.

Behavior of shotnum

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata¶

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata.condition_shotnum_int(shotnum, dheader, shotnumkey)¶
bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata.condition_shotnum_list(shotnum, dheader, shotnumkey, intersection_set)¶
class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata.hdfReadData(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: numpy.recarray

Reads the data out of the HDF5 file:

info¶

A dictionary container of metadata for the extracted data. The dict() keys are:

hdf file str HDF5 file name the data was retrieved from
dataset name str name of the dataset
dataset path str path to said dataset in the HDF5 file
digitizer str digitizer group name
adc str analog-digital converter in which the data was recorded on
bit int bit resolution for the adc
sample rate (int, float) tuple containing sample rate, e.g. (100.0, ‘MHz’)
board int board that the probe was connected to
channel int channel of the board that the probe was connected to
voltage offset float voltage offset of the digitized signal
probe name str name of deployed probe…empty for user to use at his/her discretion
port (int, str) 2-element tuple indicating which port the probe was deployed on, eg. (19, ‘W’)

When inheriting from numpy, the object creation and initialization is handled by __new__ instead of __init__.

Parameters:
  • hdf_file (bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File) – object instance of the HDF5 file
  • board (int) – board number of data to be extracted
  • channel (int) – channel number of data to be extracted
  • index (None, int, list(int), or slice()) – row index/indices of dataset to be extracted (overridden by shotnum)
  • shotnum (None, int, list(int), or slice()) – global HDF5 shot number (overrides index)
  • digitizer (str) – name of digitizer for which board and channel belong to
  • adc (str) – name of analog-digital-converter in the digitizer for which board and channel belong to
  • config_name (str) – name of the digitizer configuration to be used
  • keep_bits (bool) – set True to keep data in bits, False (default) convert data to voltage
  • add_controls (list of strings and/or 2-element tuples. If an element is a string, then the string is the control device name. If an element is a 2-element tuple, then tuple[0] is the control device name and tuple[1] is a unique specifier for that control device.) – list of control devices whose data will be matched with the digitizer data
  • intersection_set (bool) –
  • silent (bool) – set True to suppress command line print out of soft warnings

Note

Keyword shots was renamed to index in version 0.1.3.dev1. Keyword shots will still work, but will be deprecated in the future.

__init__(*args, **kwargs)¶
static __new__(hdf_file, board, channel, index=None, shotnum=None, digitizer=None, adc=None, config_name=None, keep_bits=False, add_controls=None, intersection_set=True, silent=False, robust_define=False, **kwargs)¶

When inheriting from numpy, the object creation and initialization is handled by __new__ instead of __init__.

Parameters:
  • hdf_file (bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File) – object instance of the HDF5 file
  • board (int) – board number of data to be extracted
  • channel (int) – channel number of data to be extracted
  • index (None, int, list(int), or slice()) – row index/indices of dataset to be extracted (overridden by shotnum)
  • shotnum (None, int, list(int), or slice()) – global HDF5 shot number (overrides index)
  • digitizer (str) – name of digitizer for which board and channel belong to
  • adc (str) – name of analog-digital-converter in the digitizer for which board and channel belong to
  • config_name (str) – name of the digitizer configuration to be used
  • keep_bits (bool) – set True to keep data in bits, False (default) convert data to voltage
  • add_controls (list of strings and/or 2-element tuples. If an element is a string, then the string is the control device name. If an element is a 2-element tuple, then tuple[0] is the control device name and tuple[1] is a unique specifier for that control device.) – list of control devices whose data will be matched with the digitizer data
  • intersection_set (bool) –
  • silent (bool) – set True to suppress command line print out of soft warnings

Note

Keyword shots was renamed to index in version 0.1.3.dev1. Keyword shots will still work, but will be deprecated in the future.

convert_to_v()¶

Warning

Not implemented yet

dt¶
Returns:time-step size (in sec) calculated from the ‘sample rate’ item in self.info.
Return type:float
dv¶
Returns:voltage-step size (in volts) calculated from the ‘bit’ and ‘voltage offset’ items in self.info.
Return type:float

Returns:full path of the dataset in the HDF5 file.

Warning

Not implemented yet
